description:
Our frontend team has been searching for a convenient way to create (and maintain!) scalable responsive web projects with a complex data structure. After trying some existing static site generators, we have spent a lot of time planning, developing, testing, rewriting, utilizing, and finally open-sourcing our own Gulp.js based setup.

This talk is about successes and failures, ongoing problems (looking at you, npm!) as well as responsibilities that come with open-sourcing.
title: Thomas Jaggi & Olga Skurativska – 2015: A Static Site Generator Odyssey
